The constant <math alttext="a subscript i"><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> gives the percent of people in year <math alttext="i"><mi>i</mi></math> who choose <math alttext="R"><mi>R</mi></math> and the constant <math alttext="b subscript i"><msub><mi>b</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> gives the percent of people in year <math alttext="i"><mi>i</mi></math> who choose <math alttext="T"><mi>T</mi></math>. The given matrix <math alttext="M"><mi>M</mi></math> is a <math alttext="2 by 2"><mn>2</mn><mo>Ã—</mo><mn>2</mn></math> transition matrix that is used to model changes between choices in successive years such that <math alttext="M times a 2 by 1 matrix with row 1 column 1 value a subscript n, row 2 column 1 value b subscript n end matrix equals a 2 by 1 matrix with row 1 column 1 value a subscript n plus 1 end subscript, row 2 column 1 value b subscript n plus 1 end subscript end matrix"><mi>M</mi><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>n</mi></msub></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mi>b</mi><mi>n</mi></msub></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mi>a</mi><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mi>b</mi><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>. Based on this model, which of the following is the best conclusion?
